docs.title: tAutoRig Documentation
docs.text: tAutoRig is a maya pluggin that allows you to create a rig for a character in a few clicks. It also contains a few tools to help you in different steps of the rigging process.

docs.title: bool
docs.text:
type : bool

Attribute class : BoolAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a boolean value. It can be either true or false.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: int
docs.text:
type : int

Attribute class : IntAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent an integer value. It can be either positive or negative.

Implemented : Yes

Color : Color

docs.title: double
docs.text:
type : double

Attribute class : DoubleAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a floating point value. It can be either positive or negative.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: string
docs.text:
type : string

Attribute class : StringAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a string value. It can be any sequence of characters.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: list
docs.text:
type : list

Attribute class : ListAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a list of values. It can be any type listed here.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: map
docs.text:
type : map

Attribute class : MapAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a map of key-value pairs. The key is always a string and the value can be any type listed here.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: vector2
docs.text:
type : vector2

Attribute class : Vector2Attribute

Description : This type is used to represent a 2D vector. It has two components, x and y. The coponents are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: vector3
docs.text:
type : vector3

Attribute class : Vector3Attribute

Description : This type is used to represent a 3D vector. It has three components, x, y and z. The coponents are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: vector4
docs.text:
type : vector4

Attribute class : Vector4Attribute

Description : This type is used to represent a 4D vector. It has four components, x, y, z and w. The coponents are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: matrix
docs.text:
type : matrix

Attribute class : MatrixAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a matrix. The size is 3x3. The elements are of type double. The components are named m11, m12, m13, m21, m22, m23, m31, m32, m33.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: color
docs.text:
type : color

Attribute class : ColorAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a color. It has four components, r, g, b and a. The components are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: quaternion
docs.text:
type : quaternion

Attribute class : QuaternionAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a quaternion. It has four components, x, y, z and w. The components are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: rect
docs.text:
type : rect

Attribute class : RectAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a rectangle. It has four components, x, y, width and height. The components are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: box
docs.text:
type : box

Attribute class : BoxAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent a box. It has six components, x, y, z, width, height and depth. The components are of type double.

Implemented : Yes

docs.title: enum
docs.text:
type : enum

Attribute class : EnumAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent an enumeration. It can be any of the values defined in the enumeration.

Implemented : No

docs.title: object
docs.text:
type : object

Attribute class : ObjectAttribute

Description : This type is used to represent an object. It can be any type listed here or any type from maya.

Implemented : No

docs.title: Data Conversion
docs.text:
The following table shows the possible conversions between the different types in the node editor.

From To Notes int bool Only works if the value of the integer is equal to 0 or 1, otherwise return false. int double int string int enum Set the value of the enum to index of the integer. double int double bool Only works if the value of the double is equal to 0.0 or 1.0, otherwise return false. double string double enum Set the value of the enum to index of the double. string int Try to convert the string to an integer. If it fails, return 0. string double Try to convert the string to a double. If it fails, return 0.0. string bool Try to convert the string to a boolean. Works with 'false', 'False', '0', 'true', 'True', '1'. If it fails, return false. string enum Set the value of the enum item corresponding to the string. Otherwise, set the value to the first item. string color Try to convert the string to a color. If it fails, return black (#000000). string vector2 Try to convert the string to a vector2. Must be in the format 'x.0,y.0'. If it fails, return (0.0,0.0).

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a path of group in the scene.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: • <string> : The path to create. Separated by a pipe '|'. Example: "root|spine|chest|neck|head".

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
mkPath "root|spine|chest|neck|head"  
// Result : Create the group hierarchy in the scene.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Opens the tAutoRig window.

The window automatically try to load the last rig created in the scene or create a new one if none is found.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Opens the node editor window.

This window is used to create or edit the rig templates, or node scripts.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• -o <string> : Open a file in the node editor.

  • -template : Open the node editor in template mode.

  • -script : Open the node editor in script mode.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Set the color of the selected objects in maya.

The color is defined by a string that can be a color name or a hexadecimal value. The hexadecimal value must be a string that starts with a '#' followed by 6 hexadecimal characters. Example : "#FF0000" for red.

The color name can be one of the following :

red pink purple deepPurple indigo blue lightBlue cyan teal green lightGreen lime yellow amber red_100 pink_100 purple_100 deepPurple_100 indigo_100 blue_100 lightBlue_100 cyan_100 teal_100 green_100 lightGreen_100 lime_100 yellow_100 amber_100

By default, the color is applied to the outliner, the viewport, the shape and the node of the object. You can specify which part of the object you want to color by using the flags : - -noOutliner : Do not color the outliner. - -noViewport : Do not color the viewport. - -noShape : Do not color the shape.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text:
• <string> : The color to set. Can be a color name or a hexadecimal value. Example : "red" or "#FF0000".

  • -noOutliner : Do not color the object in the outliner.

  • -noViewport : Do not color the object in the viewport.

  • -noShape : Do not color the shape of the object.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
tColor "red"
// Set the color of the selected objects to red.

tColor "#FF0000"
// Set the color of the selected objects to red.

tColor "red" -noOutliner
// Set the color of the selected objects to red. Do not color the outliner.

tColor "red" -noViewport
// Set the color of the selected objects to red. Do not color the viewport.

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
Identifier : onRun

Description : This node is used as a starter node for the rigging process. It will execute the rigging process or the script from this node by default.

Is a flow node : Yes

Combo Key : or

Group : Execution

Available in : Script & Template

docs.title: Right Outputs
docs.text: Identifier Type  Description  output_0 flow Trigger the next node in the flow.
